intro: Diplostephium extenuatum, commonly known as the slender devil's ivy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its adaptability, it can be cultivated as a decorative plant in warm climates.
